content.match_overview: This London derby arrives with Chelsea pushing for top-four consolidation (4th, 49pts) while Tottenham (14th, 34pts) seek to salvage a disappointing campaign. Chelsea boast a formidable home record (W8-D4-L2), contrasting with Spurs' dire away form (W5-D1-L8). The Blues won December's reverse fixture 4-3 in a thriller, extending their H2H dominance (9 wins in last 12 PL meetings) [1][9][13]. Recent xG data shows Chelsea averaging 1.98 xG/home game vs Tottenham's 1.43 xG/away [3][14], suggesting a tactical mismatch favoring the hosts.
